page.title: 17ALLOTMENTS
page.content: At the back of our playground there are allotments. These plots of land are used for many things like planting vegetables, fruit and sometimes flowers. They use rods for measurement instead of metres. One rod equals nine feet. Ten rods cost seven pounds. There are 49 allotments. Most people grow potatoes, carrots, parsnips, leeks and tomatoes. One man keeps bees. Some people share a plot and all the gardeners live locally. They love keeping their plots clean and tidy. There is a small shop which sells tools, seeds and peat. Each day people are working on the land and one man spends 2 hours a day there. The allotments are surrounded by houses. In the centre it is like a large field in the country.
